pullRequest.body:
This way I can avoid the large imports warning in #17632.

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

nodes.body:
### PR summary [f68d330aa5](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/17678/commits/f68d330aa53ce1e60dbb1a2433f6c0361b8dab31)

Import changes exceeding 2%

| %      | File |
| -      | -    |
| +12.82% | `Mathlib.Order.Defs` |

<details><summary>

#### Import changes for modified files

</summary>

Dependency changes

| File | Base Count | Head Count | Change |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| Mathlib.Order.Defs | 39 | 44 | +5 (+12.82%) |
| Mathlib.Order.SupClosed | 509 | 502 | -7 (-1.38%) |
| Mathlib.Combinatorics.SetFamily.Shatter | 531 | 529 | -2 (-0.38%) |


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
|<details><summary>3 files</summary> `Mathlib.Order.CompleteSublattice` `Mathlib.Order.SupClosed` `Mathlib.Order.Sublattice`</details>|-7|
| `Mathlib.Algebra.Module.Submodule.Invariant` `Mathlib.Combinatorics.SetFamily.Shatter`|-2|
|<details><summary>9 files</summary> `Mathlib.Tactic.Subsingleton` `Mathlib.Tactic.ITauto` `Mathlib.Testing.Plausible.Testable` `Mathlib.Tactic.CC` `Mathlib.Logic.Basic` `Mathlib.Tactic.CC.Addition` `Mathlib.Algebra.NeZero` `Mathlib.Tactic.Tauto` `Mathlib.Data.Bool.Basic`</details>|2|
|<details><summary>8 files</summary> `Mathlib.Algebra.Group.Commute.Defs` `Mathlib.Tactic.GCongr.Core` `Mathlib.Deprecated.AlgebraClasses` `Mathlib.Tactic.GCongr.CoreAttrs` `Mathlib.Algebra.Group.Semiconj.Defs` `Mathlib.Order.Defs` `Mathlib.Data.Int.Order.Basic` `Mathlib.Data.Ordering.Lemmas`</details>|5|

</details>

</details>

---

#### Declarations diff

No declarations were harmed in the making of this PR! 游냋
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.
I have to think whether that's the right thing to do, rather than eg making `OrdConnected` a less heavy import

I think it makes sense to have these definitions in a `Defs` file, for the same reason other `Defs` files make sense: this is a pretty basic notion which you often need no API whatsoever to prove. `OrdConnected`, or any of the other imports in `UpperLower.Basic`, aren't really all that heavy. It's just that the file I need `IsLowerSet` for is a very early file as well.
So, did you think about this? @YaelDillies
Yes I have thought about it. I would like to have a general `Order.Defs` file with all the very basic definitions, rather than one `Defs` file per set of basic definitions.
I like that approach. Will adjust this PR accordingly.
Actually, turns out `Order/Defs` is so low-level `Set` hasn't been defined at that point! So we do need at the very least two Defs files.
Can't we import Data.Set.Defs there?
I feel a bit uneasy modifying the imports of a file only 50 imports deep, but I guess I can try. I'll do so tomorrow.
The large import warning is pretty misleading, since the count just goes from 39 to 44 :P
And only a handful of files have their imports increased at all 游꿀
maintainer merge
游 Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by YaelDillies.

Thanks! :tada:
bors merge

Build failed (retrying...):
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11634642324/job/32402300929)

Build failed:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11635738049/job/32405727990)
@urkud This PR is ready for Bors now.
bors merge

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11639384211/job/32415483367)
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11639384211/job/32415483227)

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - chore(Order/UpperLower/Basic): move definitions to `Defs` file

source.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(Order/InitialSeg): extra lemmas on `풤 곣i `
